label: A2BC4_oP28_50_gh_ac_ghm-001
title: Orthorhombic La$_{2}$NiO$_{4}$ Structure
comments:
La$_{2}$NiO$_{4}$ exhibits several temperature-driven structural phase transitions: \begin{itemize} \item The ground state, a low-temperature \href{current_web_home_dir/A2BC4_tP28_138_i_c_aei-001}{tetragonal structure}. \item  Above 70K it transforms into the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2C4_oC28_64_a_f_ef-003}{orthorhombic La$_{2}$CuO$_{4}$ structure}. \item At 694K it transforms to the parent Ruddlesden-Popper structure, \href{current_web_home_dir/A4B2C_tI14_139_ce_e_a-001}{K$_{2}$NiF$_{4}$} (Villars,2016). \item It has also been observed in this orthorhombic \href{current_web_home_dir/A2BC4_oP28_50_gh_ac_ghm-001}{space group $Pban$ \#50} (Odier, 1986). \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 (Odier, 1986) give the structure in the $Pncb$ setting of space group \#50, but we present it in the standard $Pban$ setting.
